That's a great plan! Setting aside 30 minutes each day, right after school, is a perfect way to establish a consistent routine and make progress on algebra. By creating a conducive environment, taking breaks, and reviewing progress regularly, you'll be able to help your brother stay focused and motivated.

Remember to be patient and encouraging throughout the process. Learning algebra can be challenging, and it's essential to celebrate small victories and acknowledge progress, no matter how small. By doing so, you'll help your brother build confidence and develop a growth mindset.

Don't hesitate to reach out if you need any further guidance or support. I'll be here to help you and your brother navigate any challenges that come your way.

Here's a final tip: Make it fun! Learning algebra doesn't have to be boring. You can incorporate games, puzzles, or real-world examples to make the subject more engaging and relevant. By doing so, you'll make the experience more enjoyable for your brother, and he'll be more likely to stay motivated and invested in his learning.

Good luck, and I hope you and your brother have a fantastic time learning algebra together!
